dict.string: If it's the first run of this version, show the first run screen
Very early setup—clear vars, activate, test, etc.
Check if KM is running, and if so, is it visible

--Disabled loop to avoid -600 errors as it was very slow! --set apscDone1 to false --set loopCount1 to 0 --repeat until apscDone1 is true or loopCount1 is 15 -- try --if application "Keyboard Maestro Engine" is not running then tell application "Keyboard Maestro Engine" to launch tell application "System Events" try set isKMvisible to visible of process "Keyboard Maestro" on error set isKMvisible to "KM not active" end try end tell set kmInst to system attribute "KMINSTANCE" tell application "Keyboard Maestro Engine" setvariable "instance_KMappStatus" instance kmInst to isKMvisible -- will be either true (visible) false (hidden) or "KM not active" (not running) end tell -- set apscDone1 to true -- on error -- set apscDone1 to false -- set loopCount1 to loopCount1 + 1 -- end try --end repeat
Wait to be sure KM is frontmost
Save current window size and location to variables
If this isn't first run, show a little placeholder window…
Display a placeholder window so we know the macro is running

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
	<head>
		<meta charset="utf-8" />
		<title>MacroBackerUpper</title>
		<style type="text/css">
			body {
				font-family: -apple-system;
				font-size: 14px;
				opacity: 1;
				transition: opacity 2s ease-in-out;
			}
		</style>
	</head>
	<body data-kmwindowid="theSplash" style="background: #e6ffac">
		<script>
			function KMWindow() {
				//fromleft, fromtop, width, height
				return "460,300";
			}

			// Close the window with fade-out after 2 seconds
			setTimeout(function () {
				document.body.style.opacity = 0;
				setTimeout(function () {
					window.close();
				}, 300); // Wait for the transition to complete before closing
			}, 300);
		</script>
	</body>
</html>
If the prefs window is open, close it, as it blocks a menu MBU needs
Quit if the export menu isn't availabe

dict.string:
The menu item File → Export → Export All Macros as Folder isn't available.
This macro can't run unless it's available. I wish I knew why it wasn't available right now, but it's not—it should be available any time the Keyboard Maestro editor is frontmost. The macro will now exit. Please check the status of the menu, and once it's available, please try the macro again.
If asked, change this variable to TRUE to enable debug logging
Some fancy footwork to start the timer with the right setting
if [ -f "$KMVAR_rg_MBU_BackupLoc"/"zSupport Files - Do not delete/zSettings.db" ]; then echo "settings dbase there"; fi

dict.string: The basic list of tasks, in task order

Initial setup and variable checks Create list of macro and group UUIDs Prepare the database! Check and warn for duplicates and invisibles Create the new backup Confirm the backup worked Set some variables and copy some files Count macros and groups Analysis: Enabled and disabled groups Analysis: Moved and renamed macros and groups Analysis: New, deleted, and identical macros and groups Analysis: Macros in modified groups Check for and remove backups over limit Prepare database for next backup Prepare the final saved backup report Display the onscreen summary dialog Clear leftover variables
Task list for first or post-big-upgrade runs

dict.string: Get the database ready to go
Warn use about duplicate and leading-dot names

array.string: Check and warn for duplicates and invisibles

dict.string: Check if backup worked (and re-enable Default Folder X); fail gently if it did not
tell application "Default Folder X" Enable end tell
Let the user know it's back
Tell the user what happened if the backup failed

This really shouldn't happen, and hopefully you'll never see this dialog. But if you do, please contact me on the Keyboard Maestro forums—there's a link in the Info: Read Me First! macro.
The macro will now delete the database, as it's in an unusable state for future backups, then exit. You can try running MacroBackerUpper again if you wish—at worst, you'll see this dialog again. At best, it works.
Error: The backup failed to run
Delete the database as it's in a bad state after a failed backup
Backup failed, inform user and quit
Save a copy of the UUID files, in case we have to rebuild the database
Get count of folders in backup folder

array.string: Set some variables and copy some files

dict.string: +Set some variables and copy UUID files to backup folder
SELECT ( SELECT COUNT(*) FROM groups_new) || '←🔸→' || (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM macros_new) AS counts

array.string: Count all groups and macros in the database

dict.string: Split out the two totals from the results
Count the records in the database
Analyze each macro group folder for changes
The main processing loop for first and subsequent backups
Make sure the temp files are gone before starting
Get ready for more-than-one backup work

array.string: Analysis: Moved and renamed macros and groups

dict.string: Analyze new, deleted, identical, and modified activity

array.string: Analysis: New, deleted, and identical macros and groups

dict.string: Analyze modified groups, macro by macro
Create "__latest" alias at top of folder list
Create the new alias via AppleScript

set apscDone1 to false set loopCount1 to 0 repeat until apscDone1 is true or loopCount1 is 15 try --if application "Keyboard Maestro Engine" is not running then tell application "Keyboard Maestro Engine" to launch try set kmInst to system attribute "KMINSTANCE" tell application "Keyboard Maestro Engine" set theLocation to getvariable "rg_MBU_BackupLoc" set theFolderToAlias to getvariable "instance_TheLatestFolderName" instance kmInst end tell set myPath to theLocation & "/" & theFolderToAlias tell application "Finder" make new alias at POSIX file theLocation to POSIX file myPath set name of result to "__latest" end tell end try set apscDone1 to true on error set apscDone1 to false set loopCount1 to loopCount1 + 1 end try end repeat
Check for backups over the user-set limit
Remove backups over backup count limit
User has set no thinning for backups folder, or there aren't enough to thin
